inn1.comm: decent delivery despite the lack of intent, a touch of inswing to the left-hander. Defended on off stump
outside off, jabbed to point
clipped to midwicket, no timing as yet
a diet of junk-balls so far from Mathews - no dissimilar to the filth that won Arthur Ashe his Wimbledon crown against Jimmy Connors
decent areas, nothing doing for Cook
that's the shot he was looking for, just an uppish drive outside off, quick outfield, finds the gap, and races up to the rope
leg stump yorker, just that that. Kieswetter is squared up as he digs out a defensive push
shorter, and tight to off stump, bending after passing the bat, and carries through to the keeper
a fraction wider, Kieswetter shuffles his front foot into a drive, but thinks better of it
unexpected lift from a good length, defended high on the bat to cover
width, but it's a slower ball, and Kieswetter is through an ambitious pull too early. Malinga fields in his followthrough
short and straight, defended with a hop to cover. Maiden
another change. The Mathews experiment lasts one over
lovely delivery, Just nibbling off the seam, and ghosting past the edge, through to the keeper
measured push to mid-on
a modicum of width, and Cook in his current form doesn't miss those. Smacked hard through point for a welcome boundary. His second
on the pads, whisked to backward square
a touch of width, and jabbed with an open face down to third man. Kieswetter has his first run of the day
a rising delivery outside off, clobbered hard off the back foot, but straight to point
slower ball, arrow straight, deflected to short midwicket and Cook makes a desperate but unnecessary dive, as the fielder fumbled his run-out attempt
on the pads, and that's excellent from Cook. Just helped down the slope, using Malinga's pace, and no-one can stop that. He's dealing in boundaries so far
on the pads again, but can't beat the fielder
wicket-to-wicket delivery, pushed with no timing back to the bowler
clipped hard to square leg, but no way through
punched into the covers, but can't pierce the ring
dabbed down to third man, thought about a second, but decided against it
cracking delivery, that one goes like an offbreak, and ghosts past the edge once again. No pace on the ball, but the length is perfect
another cutter, clipped to midwicket
flicked square again, a fumble at midwicket allows the single
defended solidly, no way through there
full and straight, midwicket intercepts
worked off the pads to square leg
devious delivery. Slower ball on a full length, and Kieswetter is hoodwinked completely. A leading edge loops to mid-on, and that's the end of that
nice welcome, outswinger on a good length, Trott pushes loosely but makes no contact
no width to work with, but Trott is unhurried as ever
squeezed out to short cover from a full length. Lovely bowling
edged and dropped by Jayawardene! That's a sitter, and unjust as well, because it was another cracking delivery. An offcutter, zipped off the edge, and should have been swallowed!
more width, and a slightly rattled cut finds thin air
a firm push to cover to escape the strike
forward and pushed to cover.
outside off, pushed to point. Solid areas, as they say
a fraction straighter and whipped to mid-on. But no way through
short, and an attempted pull. Strikes the pad
a flick off the pads, and is Cook strangled down the leg-side for the second time in the series? Sri Lanka think so, but Billy Bowden is unmoved. Think that flicked the pad
nurdled into space at midwicket
punched very straight, back down the ground, and a quick single as two men converge from mid-off and -on respectively
full length again, and defended back down the wicket
width, and smacked. That's Cook's slot. Bread-and-butter cut shot to the boundary
firmly forward, and picked up at cover
straight and constraining. Worked up to mid-on with a full face of the bat
signs of aggression in Trott's footwork, but nothing more than a calm push to cover
tip-and-run, and Trott would have been struggling if Dilshan's shy had hit from mid-off. That was swift work, but just wide
nipping from leg to off, and keeps a touch low. Flicked to midwicket
bosh, that's the way to do it. Just strays onto Cook's pads too much, and another boundary whistles through midwicket with a firm clip
5 from 25
oh dear, that's the end of that. Driven loosely, and in the air, possibly over-anxious about getting his run-rate moving. And that's scooped easily to mid-off
outside off, curling back towards off stump. Left alone
KP bides his time
bat and pad tight together for a push to mid-on. The Red Bull run is still in the locker for now
two steps down the track and an elegant clip to square leg. He's away now
Kulasekara does nothing more or less than find a decent length and line. Cook blocks
prodded into the leg side. Amazing the power of nibbling medium pace on a flat track, apparently
good line again, hint of movement down the slope, Cook solid in defence
Sri Lanka have been very sharp in the field today. Here Kulasekara dives to his right to field off his own bowling
plenty of width on offer here but held back enough to deceive Cook

almost! Kulasekara has bothered Cook all morning. Here an expansive drive was edged low towards slip and it landed just short of Jayawardene. Good save from him, doesn't make up for the drop though. Maiden over
Pietersen is edging down the wicket and towards the off side, looking to flick boundaries into the leg side. Picks out the fielder though
good work from Lakmal, following Pietersen wider of off as the batsman tries to walk across his stumps
this time Pietersen lands it! With a packed off-side field, Pietersen strolls across his stumps and whips a boundary from outside off to square leg
wonderful shot, perfectly straight bat hits this, at the top of its bounce, perfectly straight down the ground for four more
three in a row! Pietersen didn't quite time this, it was a thickish edge that squirted through point. The outfield is very swift and it ran away to the rope
when Pietersen hit this it looked four straight away. As it was he picked out deep square but a short ball was nailed with a pull shot. Happily for the batsman, he keeps the strike
good work from Kulasekara, just holding a length and line. Blocked carefully
lovely bowling, very strong willed from Kulasekara. Saw Pietersen advancing menacingly but delivered a slower one that deceived the batsman
after a couple of good ones Kulasekara slams down a short ball a long way down the leg side
Pietersen is rooted to the crease and can't pick out a gap in the leg side. Top bowling
yorker this time! He's now bowled 11 deliveries in a row without conceding a run off the bat
finally Pietersen does manage to nudge a single
Cook very solid in defence but after flurry of boundaries in the last over Sri Lanka have come back well
Pietersen's taste for pace on the ball is visible but Lakmal's line is too good for him to get away
brilliant from Pietersen. Advanced down to make an off-stump length ball into a half-volley and flicks with perfect timing, beating the diving sweeper on the leg-side boundary for four
oh dear! After the peerless boundary comes an almighty swish at fresh air. Credit to the bowler, he pushed it wide of off
driven hard towards the cover boundary where it's fielded smartly
Dilshan misses at mid-off, sliding past a firmly-struck drive and it rushes through to the boundary. Pietersen ticking now
yorker saves the rot but Pietersen pinches the strike, again, with an inside edge to mid-on
Kulasekara continues his calm, hit-a-good-line approach and Pietersen has no where to go
smart bowling, just varying the length slightly and Pietersen's leg-side nudge finds the fielder
touch fuller here and flicked around the corner
there we go, Cook finally gets a ball to face and efficiently shovels it to the leg side to bring Pietersen back on strike
big appeal from Kulasekara as Pietersen wandered out his ground, but it was outside the line. Really good bowling though, difficult to tell why he's so hard to get away but he clearly is
...unless he bowls a rank long-hop. Pietersen couldn't believe his luck and just stood tall and whacked it to to the midwicket rope
starts well enough for Cook to block
good line, tight around middle and spinning in. Cook prods to leg
worked away for a single which brings Pietersen back on strike
good line and length from Mendis, sliding on quickly. Pietersen hurries in defence
this time Pietersen stretches forward to meet the delivery but can't get it away
excellent opening over from Mendis. He's troubled Pietersen so far this series and has clearly earned his respect as this is very carefully blocked
such a strange action, there is no snap at all, just walks through the whole thing. Still, the line is tight and Cook defends
with a flick of the wrists Cook works this down the ground
top, diving fielding at midwicket as Pietersen whips this from two foot outside off
more delicate from the batsman this time, rolling his wrists over the ball to deflect it round the corner
Cook forces off the back foot through midwicket
good call from Cook earns Pietersen a single with a gentle glance to short fine leg
Pietersen edges down the track to meet this flighted delivery, clips to leg
good work from Cook, dipping this to leg to rotate the strike
good bowling here, Mendis saw Pietersen galloping down at him and threw it out wider of off
Cook tries to cut from the back foot but not enough space for him to time it
and again Cook tries to squeeze a cut, this was far too close and the bottom edge would have alarmed the batsman
Mendis completes his second good over on the bounce. Sri Lanka building good pressure here again
cry of "catch" as Pietersen slammed this in the air past the diving bowler. Would have been a blinder
Cook again dabs a single into the leg side
very careful from Pietersen, working the ball away with his wrists but still just a single
prodded with soft hands to leg
the run of singles is ended with Pietersen unable to dink a single
this time Pietersen jumps down the wicket and fiddles one to leg, keeping the strike in the process
excellent bowling from Mendis! So slow. Pietersen danced down before aiming a pull shot which he was almost completely through when the ball arrived
appeal again from the bowler as this finds the pads with Pietersen down the track
Pietersen jumps back and forces firmly to long-off
carefully prodded forward defence, excellent lengths and lines from Mendis

Mendis does for Pietersen again! Great work from him this over. Googly here that Pietersen tries to sweep, the extra bounce finds a top edge that loops all the way to deep midwicket. Ends such a promising innings but the spinners have heaped pressure on England
Morgan gets a googly first ball that he cuts hard to cover
on a length to start, Cook stands up to punch to cover
good length outside off once again, this time the ball takes a thick edge, flying well wide of the man at slip and down to third man
tapped watchfully to cover
a touch shorter and Morgan leaves a rising ball outside off well alone
Morgan is in no rush here, letting another one go outside off. This is a really good wicket for batting, he'll want to settle in for a long knock
or will he? Lakmal pushes another one across the left-hander, who leans back and flashes hard, but doesn't get a touch on the ball. Past the top edge
this one goes on with the arm, but Cook picks it and steps forward to drive to long-off
pulled powerfully to midwicket! This really wasn't that short, but Morgan picked up the length so quickly and whipped it into the leg side

gone this time! Mendis spins one back in as Morgan shuffles back onto his stumps, he's hit on the pad to spark a huge appeal and Billy raises one crooked finger to send the batsman on his way. Another very valuable wicket for Sri Lanka
Mendis tosses up a googly straight away, but it's not particularly well disguised and is easily pushed down to long-on
Cook stretches well forward and works the ball to midwicket
flighted temptingly on off stump, Bell drives to long-off
short and wide outside off, Bell doesn't try anything extravagant just yet, just getting the ball down to third man for a single
Cook steps forward and drives the ball to mid-off with a solid crunch
fetched into the leg side with plenty of bottom hand, a good sliding stop saves a couple of runs
Bell walks into a stroke, but the shortish length means he can only defend
fuller this time, but a mistimed drive trickles to mid-off
full once again, and wider still. This time Bell lets it go
tapped back to the bowler
a yelp of excitement as the ball is nudged into the leg side, but that's come off the bat
this time Cook does find the gap for a single on the leg side
paddled down to fine leg for one
lobbed up terrifically slowly, Cook drives back to the bowler
short and wide, really gentle, and Cook slaps the ball away to the backward point boundary
just short of a good length on off stump, Bell gets over the ball and angles to third man
Cook is drawn forward, and drives straight to Dilshan in the covers
Malinga aims for the yorker and gets some nice curve back in through the air towards Cook's toes, but it's a little too full and is clipped through square leg

comedy of errors from Sri Lanka! It wasn't the easiest take for Sangakkara, the ball bouncing in front of him as Bell left alone, but he let it right through his legs ... and then Chandimal slid past the ball as he tried to stop it at third man, four byes!
good follow-up by Malinga, flinging down a much slower one that Bell only picks very late. Off the leading edge to cover, but all along the ground
short and fast this time, Bell is rushed but manages a pull out to midwicket
eased down to long-off for one
very full outside off, squeezed out to point
Sri Lanka's fielding is looking a bit amateurish at the moment, as now Dilshan runs past a ball at midwicket to allow a single
a floaty legspinner is tapped back to the bowler
Bell sends the ball down to fine leg with a paddle sweep
worked into the leg side, but straight to the fielder
snaking back in to Bell through the air, he nudges to midwicket and they take a single ... they think of a second but decide against it
clipped neatly to square leg! That was there to be hit, pitched up on thte pads, and the ball pinged right out of the middle
whipped off the legs again, this time he finds the man on the boundary
short on leg stump, Bell thinks about the hook but ducks out of the shot
full, fast and straight, Bell nudges to square leg for a single
more runs for Cook, and that's his fifty! Malinga tried to deceive him with the slow offcutter, but pushed the ball down the leg side and Cook glanced easily down to fine leg
Bell waits deep in his crease, and cuts to point
a touch short, Bell isn't quite in the right position but gets it down to long-off
there's the wrong 'un, but picked and defended
driven to long-on
tossed up full and straight, tapped back to the bowler
too wide this time, and Bell finds the gap on the off side for a single
he doesn't quite get his length right, and Bell steps back to punch to long-on
the ball comes of the inner half and rolls to short fine leg, Bell is alert to the chance for a single, and calls Cook through
a touch of extra bounce for Randiv, but Bell rides it well and plays to gully
worked with the spin into the leg side
Cook keeps his weight back and cuts out to deep cover
and another single to end the over, this time to long-on
and now it's Mendis who is too short, but the punishment is not severe as he is cut away for a single
a googly is pushed back to the bowler
Cook shuffles right across to off to open up the leg side, nudging it away for one
another flighted googly is angled to short fine leg
legspinner this time, Cook stays back to work it off the back foot but hits straight to midwicket
driven through mid-off for a single
Randiv starts on a much better length than his previous over, Cook caught neither forward nor back and defending awkwardly
looped up very full again, from around the wicket, this time Cook finds a single through square leg
played with the spin, the ball rolling behind square on the leg side
a flighted offspinner is driven to extra cover
this one rushes straight on with the arm, but the bat is right behind it in defence
flicked into the leg side for a single
a gentle wrong 'un is driven to long-off
flighted very full on leg stump, Bell chips off his toes into the deep
whipped off the pads out to deep square
that's a better line, closer to middle and off and Bell taps back to the bowler
an uncharacteristically agricultural heave into the leg side from Bell, and he's lucky to get away with it! The ball sails into the leg side, but drops short of the man sprinting across from long-on
driven to long-off for a single to end the over
a very excited Randiv asks Nigel Llong for a decision as Bell is struck on the pad, playing back, but the umpire says no. Marginal decision, the ball may just have clipped leg
defended this time
nudged into the leg side
paddled to short fine leg for a single
full and straight, from round the wicket, and Cook sends the ball rolling out to wide long-on
nice, tight end to the over, and Bell defends
lobbed up on the toes, Cook nudges to midwicket
this time he finds the gap on the leg side for a single
no turn at all on this delivery, and Bell flicks into the leg side
a hint of drift through the air, Cook's clip goes to square leg
flighted very full outside off, squirted away through point
eased down to long-off, and they amble through for a single
chopped down to third man for a single
hurled very wide of off stump, wide called
Malinga re-adjusts, firing one very full at off stump. Dug out to cover
full and straight again, nice and fast too. Cook pushes it back to the the bowler, who lets it through his legs ... no single to be had though
Malinga keeping the ball right up to the bat here, as Cook squeezes one down to third man off the outside edge
slower ball, an offcutter, but Bell is equal to it and finds a single down to third man
Cook angles his bat down onto a yorker outside off to find yet another single down to third man
good start to the new spell from Kulasekara, landing it full and straight. Cook digs out to mid-off

Cook attempts to force a drive but can't get much of it. Toe-ends onto the ground and loops up back to the bowler. Sri Lanka appeal suggesting it might have come off the boot and the umpires go upstairs but it confirms boot
again driven hard into the ground but this time Kulasekara  can't collect cleanly
this Powerplay hasn't quite sparked a boundary frenzy. Instead Bell defends
better intent here from Bell, skipping down the wicket and giving himself room outside leg, can't time the drive though
thickish edge runs past point and the batsmen stroll a single
good diving stop from Malinga at mid-off saves a firm push from Cook. He's just no good at hitting over the top
high full toss he helped down to deep square. Bell thought it was no-ball height but it was probably around thigh high
Cook bunts a single to mid-on. But with a full toss offered he'll feel he's missed out
touch too wide from Lakmal but again an England batsman can't take full toll. 58 balls since the last boundary as Bell guides this towards cover
Cook moves across to the off side to try and work to leg but he can't time his flick well enough to beat the infield
Bell's struggle ends and Sri Lanka are well on top now! Banged in very short, Bell leant back and upper-cut straight to a gleeful third man
driven without a world of timing to mid-off. Cook coots through for one
England's No. 7, Bresnan, pushes confidently but only at fresh air
this time Bresnan finds bat on ball in sturdy defence
slower ball fools the batsman but a thick edge beats Sangakkara and gets Bresnan off the mark
Cook nurdles into the leg side, placing it behind square to take a couple. England's last 22 runs were all singles, so that's an improvement of sorts
Kulasekara has bowled awfully well today and Cook can't get him away
swerving, menacing yorker towards Bresnan's toes. Fiddled into the leg side
edge works the treat for Cook and England! First boundary since the 28th over as Cook slices a drive over point and to the rope. Precious relief for the crowd
top work from Malinga, full and swinging away again. Cook defends to cover
edge comes to Cook's aid again, this time it goes along the ground but past point for a single
lovely slower ball, impossible to read and Bresnan had no clue. Hung his bat out, waited and waited and watched the ball pass it
this time the yorker is overcooked into a full toss and Bresnan clips it to deep square
starts with a shortish ball that Bresnan works for a single to midwicket
Kandamby gives this more air and Cook shovels to deep square
plenty of air on this, really tossed up, when it eventually came down Bresnan drove nicely but only to the off-side sweeper
clump! Filthy full toss that had to be smacked. Cook obligingly nailed a cross-bat thump to the fence
another full toss but lower this time and Cook pushes more gently to deepish mid-on
Bresnan keeps the strike with a drive to deep cover
Randiv walks through another delivery which Bresnan nibbles to leg
Randiv almost gets a bonus wicket as a touch of bounce causes Cook to miscue his cut, which landed just short of point
this is worked more securely to the leg side
Bresnan pokes a full-face drive into space
quicker ball hurries Cook into defence
Cook keeps the strike by flicking to deep square
big cheer from the crowd as Malinga dives over a ball at fine leg, allowing Cook to advance to the 90s and pass 1000 ODI runs with a fine leg glance
driven without much timing to cover as Lakmal finds a better line
change of length as the bowler drags back. The line remains good and Cook can't manoeuvre  the ball into space
Cook gets an inside edge on a leg glance that thuds off his pad into the leg side
top work from Bresnan, managed to get his feet out the way as this swung back towards his toes. Quick hands clipped the ball firmly and good placement earned him four in front of deep midwicket
worked around the corner to end a better over for England
Randiv is a touch short but Bresnan can't generate much power on his cut and finds cover. They cross for one but it's a swift single
Cook bottom-edges a cut shot that somehow gets through the keeper and Cook steals a couple
dragged down much shorter and Cook cuts to the sweeper
again it's short from Randiv but Bresnan's firmly-struck cut finds deep point
tip and run from Cook pushing into the off side
another single as Bresnan forces a drive through cover off the back foot
Bresnan got the width he wanted to slash a cut and he nailed it, but straight to point
short ball is pulled, but not timed so it's just a single to deep square

big appeal from Lakmal as Cook shuffles across his stumps to work to leg. Given runs so perhaps there was an inside edge. Doesn't look like it on HotSpot but it pitches outside anyway. Brings up England's 200 though, not a moment too soon they would think
Lakmal lands a good slower ball that forces Bresnan to change his shot. Credit to the batsman he adjusted well to guide a single to third man
Lakmal saw Cook advancing so dug it in short and forced the batsman to push a single to mid-off
good slower ball again that Bresnan can't time. He gave himself room to try and pierce the infield but can't
Randiv happy to give some air and Cook can't get it away. Better hurry, Malinga is lurking
Cook advances looking to go over the top but can't quite get there in time so settles for a single
Bresnan hops deep into his crease to pull down to deep square
ooh, play and a miss outside off as Cook tries to nail his favourite cut shot
ooh! Close again as a leading edge lands just short of the bowler

that is Cook's hundred! Gets there by pushing a single down the ground, which is fitting. It may not have been electric but it's a hugely important ton for the man and the team. No great celebration, he knows he needs to finish with a flurry
good intent from Cook, trying to loft Malinga down the ground. Beats mid-off without timing it perfectly
full, fast and straight from Malinga and Cook picks out square leg
this time Cook manages to pierce the infield but England need more than singles
slower ball from Malinga, at a perfect yorker length, Bresnan squeezes it out onto the leg side but boundaries off Malinga don't come easy
dropped again! Kandamby this time spills Cook. He tried to smash this to leg and it looped out to deep point where Kandamby ran in and dropped it
slower ball that Bresnan heaves hard at. No great result for the batsman though as it trickles away
good start from the bowler, full and straight. Swung off the toe-end down to long-on
Cook shapes to scoop very early, so Lakmal floats it up outside off, Cook had to adjust late and ended up guiding it to third man. Good invention from both sides there
ah there was the half-volley that Bresnan wanted but he couldn't time his big shot down the ground. Instead he chipped one-bounce short of long-off running in
this is tough for Cook, he knows he needs  boundaries but can't seem to find a shot to bring them. Slower ball from Lakmal is well directed and Cook's almighty heave misses
Cook walks across his stumps so Lakmal follows him, ends up too far outside off though. Harsh call I reckon
again Cook aims big with a drive but again he can only slice it and it loops out towards deep cover. You can sense Cook's frustration
one final big heave of the over for Cook and yet again it flies off the top edge, this time down to third man. Still, a couple is better than nothing
brilliant, diving stop at mid-off from Jayawardene denies Bresnan a boundary from a well-struck drive. Malinga missed his yorker length but got away with it
Cook is getting stuck here. Malinga's low full toss is too tough to get away it seems
brilliant slower ball has Cook through his shot far too early. Goes under the bat and dribbles through to the keeper. This innings started with a whimper and is ending with, well, a whimper
crowd getting annoyed now as Cook swings over another perfectly-delivered Malinga yorker. Such fantastic bowling
Cook's attempts to hit out are getting cruder and cruder but Malinga's wily slower ball is proving too hard for him. Big swing across the line finds an edge onto his body and trickles away
fine, fine over from Malinga ends with Bresnan toe-ending a slower ball over mid-off but it's still only a couple
Cook gets one away! Good short too. Down the wicket, outside off and dragging it to the midwicket rope. Top work from Cook
Kulasekara's follow-up is sound. He knows Cook wants to go leg side so floats it up outside off and Cook leaves alone looking for a wide that doesn't come
shot! That's nailed. Cook jumped outside off stump and Kulasekara dragged it short. On the pull Cook got all of it and beat the sweeper on the leg side
Kulasekara rightly goes well outside off in response and a drive is squirted down to third man

Cook falls trying to steal a bye. Sangakkara hit the stumps with his under-arm flick and it ends a very important innings for Cook. He gets a standing ovation and rightly so, he may not have been swift but England's other batsmen didn't allow him to be
too wide from Kulasekara, going very full a long way outside off
another wide, very generous from Kulasekara. Aiming well wide of off again
despite being fined for dissent last match Broad challenges the umpire again as this is not given wide

...and strikes with the first ball! Yorker swerves in, finds the inside-edge that cannons off the pad onto the stumps. Dot ball too. Pretty decent effort from Bresnan again, without his fifty stand with Cook England would be in even worse shape
Swann manages to keep out the yorker, he didn't have ambitions for much more than that but at least it earns a single
wonderful slower ball completely hoodwinks Broad. He ended up holding his bat in line and watching the ball loop up just over Malinga's head
another slower one and Swann can't connect. England don't risk a bye this time, when actually they might have made it
a six! The crowd are delirious, with surprise presumably. Tough for Malinga, just got the length and line slightly wrong and allowed Swann to clip with ideal timing over the midwicket boundary
four this time! Finally England can smile! Swann hurtles down the wicket and top edges a swipe wide of the keeper and it runs away for four

inn2.comm: Anderson gets one to shape away from the bat straight away, but it's wide of off and easily left alone
another outswinger, this one is on a length and straighter than the last, and is defended to cover
short, wide and going wider. Jayawardene kicks off Sri Lanka's chase with a fluent cut that is smacked deliberately in the air out to deep point
dropped close, into a gap on the leg side, and they sprint through for one
pitching and leaving the batsman, who gets across to off stump and leaves alone
Anderson ends the over with a decent delivery that curves away from the bat, but he's just short of a good length and Dilshan has time to judge it and whip his bat inside the line to leave
loose start, and Jayawardene has his second boundary! Bresnan sends down a long half-volley that is caressed through the covers with minimum fuss
this one appeared to bend gently away through the air, but Jayawardene got well forward and across to cover the movement and defend
pitched up outside off but not quite there for the drive, and so left alone
that's the length! Jayawardene wasn't quite sure which way to go, and just stood at the crease and thrust his bat out in defence, only to be beaten on the outside edge
another outswinger, this one too wide to get the batsman playing
fuller and straighter, solidly defended to cover
this one hits the seam and jags back in, and is nudged to leg
swinging away outside off, Jayawardene hops back to guide to third man
Dilshan practically swings himself off his feet trying to thrash a short ball to midwicket, but only gets one for his troubles as there's a man in the deep
Sri Lanka paid the price for a couple of dodgy runs early on in their innings at Headingley, but this is well-judged as the ball is tapped wide of the man inside the ring at midwicket
speared down the leg side, that's a wide
short of a good length and rising towards the armpit, Dilshan stands tall and clips to leg
drifting towards the legs once again and Jayawardene eases the ball down to fine leg

not too short but very wide indeed, Jayawardene bends his knees to cut off the front foot, and though Broad is quick enough to get to the ball sprinting round from third man, he slides and it bobbles out his grasp to give away the boundary
just short of the man at midwicket! The shot to leg was on as the ball was heading in that direction, but Mahela was a little too early in the stroke
an appeal for lbw, and then another for a catch as the ball loops to gully ... but Billy says no to both. Heading down leg, and he didn't get a touch on it. Good decision
watchful defence this time
after an over of outswingers, Bresnan now seems to be moving them back in. Mahela drops this one at his feet and they sprint through for one, Bresnan's kick sending the ball wide of the stumps

bowled 'im! Bresnan knocks back the off stump with a perfect length delivery that beats a loose defensive push. That was a great delivery, Dilshan's feet went nowhere and subtle movement took the ball past the bat
wobbling around on a length, defended off the back foot
Jayawardene shuffles across to off to defend to point
short on off stump, Jayawardene isn't troubled on a gently-paced pitch and swivels into a one-legged pull that sends the ball racing to midwicket
four more! Anderson sends one down on leg stump, and Jayawardene just gets a touch on it to pick up a boundary at fine leg
Anderson really seemed to bend his back in this delivery, picking up a yard of pace but the line and length still aren't quite right as Jayawardene clips out to KP at deep midwicket
Chandimal is greeted with a bouncer on off stump, and sways out of the way
glanced off the pad, but straight to the man at short fine leg. A yard either side of him and that was four
nudged to mid-on
caressed through the covers! Jayawardene steps into a picture-percect drive, picking the gap on the off side. Silky touch
whipped through leg this time, Pietersen is out on the boundary and hauls it back in
eventually Bresnan finds the right line and length, and Jayawardene has to defend
a hint of extra bounce as Bresnan hits the pitch hard, but it's outside off and easily left
Chandimal does not look nearly as solid as Jayawardene yet, the ball takes a thick inside edge as he defends with the hands well away from the body
a shorter ball is fended in slightly ungainly fashion
just short of a good length, this time Chandimal is right behind it to defend
seaming back in from outside off, Chandimal gets across to defend, half-forward

well, his defence may be a bit ropey but he's pretty impressive when he attacks! Anderson sends down another short ball and Chandimal hops and swivels into a hook, the ball racing to midwicket in an instant
Anderson goes fuller to end the over, Chandimal defends
on a length and straight, Jayawardene works the ball to leg for a single
shot! Chandimal steps into a confident drive, flashing his hands quickly through the line to send the ball screaming to the cover boundary
Bresnan responds by pulling his length back, and Chandimal defends to leg
Chandimal looks to whip a length delivery to leg but misses and is struck a stinging blow on the upper thigh
slanting in towards the pads, Chandimal clips firmly to the man close at midwicket
full outside off, Chandimal comes forward to defend to cover point
too straight again from Anderson, but luckily for him the glance goes straight to the man at short fine leg. There's no-one behind him

Jayawardene leans over a leg-stump half volley and sends the ball rolling towards deep midwicket ... Broad and Pietersen close in on it from different sides, Broad sliding and cutting it off, Pietersen hurling it back in
and is immediately in action as Chandimal glances off his hip
great timing as Jayawardene turns the ball through square leg! Pietersen was after it again, but gave up the chase
a better line, aimed right at off stump, and Jayawardene defends
and more front-foot defence to end the over
full and straight, Chandimal walks across and nudges to midwicket. Decent thinking, but if he'd missed that there would've been a huge lbw shout
pulled in the air to deep square leg, and Pietersen is once again the fielder after it ... and he does well, stopping it inside the rope
take that! Chandimal thrashes a length delivery on the up through cover, Trott taking evasive action at short extra cover. That was cracked really hard
straighter again, and Chandimal defends
a slower ball is landed full outside off, Chandimal steps forward to drive to mid-off
Chandimal is living dangerously! Bresnan pitched one up and he tried to smash it over mid-off, but sliced at the ball and got underneath it ... but hit well enough to elude the man sprinting back
good pace straight away from Broad, but the ball is directed towards leg stump and beyond and they take a single as it comes off the pad
Chandimal flicks his wrists over a full delivery on middle and leg, and there's another single taken
Broad hits a good length, and Chandimal can only defend
nicely straight, Chandimal attempts to manufacture a shot, getting across to off, but clips it straight to the midwicket fielder
dug in shorter, the ball spits up at the batsman but he rides the bounce and makes sure to keep the ball down as he pulled to long leg
Jayawardene angles his bat to pick up a single to third man
angled in towards the hip, Jayawardene glances and they sprint back for a second
drifting towards leg stump once again, Jayawardene helps the ball on its way to fine leg
leg side yet again, Chandimal whips the ball to fine leg, working with the angle
the line is outside off this time, but a single is still the result as Jayawardene nudges to third man
turned to midwicket for one more
singles coming very easily, this one nurdled through square leg
on a length and straight, Jayawardene gets in line and defends
chopped down through gully, backward point dives across but can't stop it, and they're back for the second
short on off stump, Jayawardene splices the pull but places it well enough for the single that takes him to fifty, from 46 deliveries. Fluent knock
great wheels from Broad, short and nasty and Chandimal finds himself in no position to play it. He thrusts the gloves in front of the face and is lucky that the ball loops safely in no-man's land
fuller this time, defended to point
same again, Chandimal stepping half-forward to defend under the eyes
nudged off the hip to fine leg
dug in short, but angling down leg ... Kieswetter shouts an appeal after catching the ball, but that's not hit anything and is called wide
fuller and right on off stump this time, defended
England are testing Chandimal on the back foot here, another short one and it's angled one-handed down to fine leg
first slower ball of the innings from Dernbach, but it's lobbed up full and wide and is slapped to the point boundary with great finesse
angled down to third man for one more
short of a good length again, turned down to fine leg for one

leg-side yet again, and it's easily flicked to fine leg ... ooh, and the Sri Lankans feel that Broad got in Chandimal's way as he completed the single. Not sure about that, but the umpire is having a word to nip any shenanigans in the bud
dug in, whipped into the leg side again
a brutish short delivery, and Chandimal is in trouble again! Hands and legs go everywhere as he fends wildly, but again it drops safely.
predictably short again, and Chandimal doesn't look at all comfortable, one hand coming off the bat as he hops back
banged in too short this time, the ball flies well over Chandimal's head as he ducks and that's called wide
back of a length, Chandimal bravely stays in line and defends

ah, are these short balls getting to him? Chandimal stepped away, shut his eyes and had a tremendous heave at this, but didn't hit a thing. Broad jogs down to congratulate him on the effort all the same
Dernbach is a touch wide and Jayawardene slices a drive down to third man. Closest thing to a false shot we've seen from him
wonderful cricket from Chandimal. He knew Dernbach would be short so crouched low, got in position early and flicked for four over his shoulder
better delivery here, on a length and defended carefully
there was  the slower ball and Chandimal aimed a serious thwack but it was too wide
too short and Chandimal absolutely laced this. On the front foot, rocked back, stood tall and thrashed it wide of midwicket for four. Stirring stuff from the youngster!
after the violence of the ball before Chandimal clips this carefully to leg
lands a rare full delivery that Jayawardene coolly clips to mid-on to steal a single and bring up Sri Lanka's 100. Brings Chandimal back on strike against Broad, this should be fun...
this is short from Broad, as expected, Chandimal gets inside the line and clips off his hip to fine leg
good delivery this, aiming for the top of off. Jayawardene eases into line to defend. Seems to move in slow motion
good again from Broad, full, Jayawardene jabs down to mid-on
Jayawardene pops into line to block solidly
this was only just short of a good length but Jayawardene wanted to pull. Wasn't really there for the shot and it struck him on the thigh
Chandimal solidly forward to Swann outside off stump
pushed through flatter and quicker. Chandimal rocks back to cut crisply
Jayawardene elegantly guides a drive through cover
tap-and-run from Chandimal, pushing into the off side and scooting off
little bit quicker from Swann but Jayawardene full-faces a single down the ground
the drifts away and keeps going, ghosting past an edge to makes Kieswetter yelp with excitement
ah lovely batting. Just picked a gap wide of mid-on and clipped a full ball with minimum of fuss or effort to the boundary
slower ball, shorter too, Jayawardene tickles around the corner
...a short ball! Fancy that! Worked around the corner easily enough, past the slip for one
Kieswetter has a long and desperate appeal. Not even Broad joined in there. It came off the thigh to the wicketkeeper
back of a length, worked to fine leg
Broad celebrates a good bouncer with a long follow through and stare. Chandimal seems to be relishing this battle as sways out the way
Swann has a slip in place, which seems a good move. Jayawardene defends
shot down the leg side from Swann and Kieswetter failed to gather cleanly
touch of air on this finds spin too. Gets an inside-edge that runs into the leg side
Chandimal defends carefully
very careful push to deep point
Jayawardene presses forward before rocking back and late cutting. Classy stuff
after the elegance comes the heave, not a great sweep shot but enough for Jayawardene to nick the strike
good take from Kieswetter diving down the leg side as Broad's short ball is misdirected
short again and Jayawardene rises with it and clips with soft hands wide of midwicket for a couple. Brings up the 100 partnership, good time too, 97 balls

this won't cheer Broad's mood. A good ball is pushed to Morgan at point, who fumbles, allowing a single, before the fielder backing up fluffed Morgan's throw and allowed an extra one. Broad has head in hands
very easily worked to the leg side for a single. Fair to say Broad isn't amused
yikes. Poor Broad. Cracking delivery beats the outside edge through to Kieswetter. Good ball, might have found the edge if it was fuller though
sharp bouncer this, rears up towards the head from a short length. Chandimal jumps with it and manages to fend it down off the gloves
another short ball, good one too, Chandimal is up to it though and guides a single to third man
Chandimal pokes a shortish Swann ball to leg
much fuller from Swann this time but it's easily milked down the ground
solid forward defence from the batsman
carefully pushed into the off side again
neatly clipped to midwicket
Jayawardene in no hurry, he doesn't need to be, and pushes a single towards point
starts with a short ball that Jayawardene block towards the off side and skips off for a single. Jimmy ran through and picked up and threw but Chandimal was home
appeal from the bowler as Anderson finds the pads but it was heading down leg
this offers to move away a fraction but it's still glided easily towards third man and smart running allows Jayawardene to come back for two
good delivery around off stump decking away. Quietly defended
just a hint of reverse and Jayawardene is careful in response
the batsman's response to the swing this time is to wander down the track a few steps. Anderson's line is still too good to allow runs
won't swing from this length - short - and even if it did the line is far too wide
short and wide again but this time Chandimal manages to toe-end a cut towards deep point

wide long-hop  works the trick for Dernbach! He celebrates wildly but Jayawardene has given him this one. It was very wide and the drive was sliced straight to Morgan at point. Ends a wonderful innings from Jayawardene
Sangakkara is away straight away. Good style too, driving elegantly to deep cover
Swann is at a wide slip and even with a dive he couldn't quite reach this. Chandimal wanted to run it to third man but it was probably finer than he wanted
good delivery from Dernbach here, swinging it in late to Chandimal
this time it holds its line outside off stump. Left alone comfortably though
angled across the left-hander who steers to point
swing for Anderson away from Sangakkara who is sturdy in defence
carefully blocked into the off side. Anderson has found good control here with some reverse as well
this does swing away from the angle in but Sangakkara is as controlled in defence
touch shorter this time which makes defence easier
this is full enough to invite a drive which is played firmly to the sweeper at deep cover
Sri Lanka very watchful at the moment. England enjoying their first good period of the innings. Sangakkara defending a length ball
just a touch shorter and Sangakkara glides down wide of third man for a couple
clipped firmly to the leg side where Pietersen fields with a needless tumble
lovely shot, Sangakkara stroked this at the top of its bounce to deep extra cover where Bresnan slid well along the rope to field
banged in short this time and left all alone
back of a length from the bowler, it won't swing from there. Sangakkara picks it off his hip to the leg side to keep the strike
top delivery from Anderson, after all the ones that went away this snaked back in and found the inside edge as Sangakkara drove expansively at it
this one does go away and is steered straight to point
the swing in both directions has Sangakkara played with bat well away from pad. Top bowling. Will you get reverse swing later in the innings with two new balls in the future?
again Sangakkara is driving well away from his body, but plays it well to deep cover
Chandimal is nearing his half-century and ticks one run closer by pushing this to midwicket
brilliant from Anderson, high-class bowling to a high-class batsman. Swinging away a long way and past a groping outside edge
Dernbach swinging it in this time. England are a completely different team in ODI cricket when the ball moves. Chandimal does well to dig out an indipper
Dernbach doesn't have Anderson's skills and gets his line wrong here, swinging it too far down leg, clips the pads and runs away past Kieswetter for four
back to a good line here and Chandimal is respectful in defence
big heave from Chandimal as he gets some space to free his arms outside off. Can't time it though and it trickles to mid-off
top delivery this time, yorker length swinging in a long way. Chandimal did well to clear his feet out the way and clamp down in time
and again! Excellent bowling from Dernbach and top brawling, as Miller would say, from Chandimal. He's battled really well this innings
Bresnan replaces Anderson after an excellent spell from Jimmy. Starts outside off stump and Sangakkara flashes and misses
this time the batsman is more secure, flicking off his hip gently enough to turn one into two
flash and a miss again! This was even wider and Sangakkara leant back to heave at it but missed
this hurries Sangakkara on the cut and trickles to point
sharp running earns a single as Sangakkara pushes solidly to mid-off
this swings in a touch at Chandimal who blocks uncomfortably
Dernbach makes a mess of this, shoving it in short and a long way down the leg side. Kieswetter dives in vain
returns to a good line but with five taken already in the over Sangakkara is happy to defend
airy drive but finds a gap at cover
Chandimal has had enough of prodding and hurtles down the wicket to slice a drive over the infield for a couple. Not perfectly played but moves him closer to the 50 he's chasing
loopy slower ball is too wide of off stump
after the last one that went very wrong Dernbach gets this very right, swinging in a long way towards Chandimal's toes
shorter this time but hugging an off-stump line. Chandimal blocks
big swing again and Chandimal still unable to get the single he wants, defending to mid-on
banged in without much intent, the ball sits up and is thumped away in front of square for four
eased out to deep cover for a single
Bresnan bowls this short one with a little more vim and vigour, but Chandimal still manages to pull out to deep midwicket - albeit without much timing - to bring up his fifty
Bresnan comes round the wicket to Sangakkara, who tries to work him to leg but can't find a gap
Sangakkara steps forward to drive to mid-off
an optimistic appeal from Bresnan as he shapes one in quite sharply and hits Sangakkara on the pad. That looked to be heading down leg
definite movement in, but the bat is right in front of it in defence
tailing in again, Chandimal wants a single but Anderson swoops in from mid-on
pitched well up outside off, there's not much flourish in Chandimal's drive but he picks the gap perfectly. Cook sprints after it, but soon gives up the chase
hurled well down the leg side, Kieswetter dives but can't cut it off and that's five wides
full and straight, Chandimal loses his balance slightly as he digs it out to mid-on
worked off the pads for an easy single
Broad keeps Sangakkara deep in his crease, the batsman defending to point
tossed up outside off, Chandimal drives through cover for a couple
there's spin for Swann, but it takes the ball towards leg stump and Chandimal turns him to short fine leg
pitched wider of off this time, pushed back to the bowler
and again, Chandimal happy to bide his time as he defends off the back foot
pushed to mid-on
Chandimal hangs back and taps back to the bowler to end a quiet over
inside edge! But the ball rebounds off the thigh and bounces through to Kieswetter. Good, probing delivery
pitched up very full this time, Sangakkara drives to mid-off
the ball snakes away from Sangakkara through the air, but is clipped to square leg for a single
this time the movement takes the ball down the leg side, and Chandimal picks up one more with a glance to long leg
sharp yorker! This one curved the other way through the air and was pitched right in the blockhole, but Sangakkara jammed down on it in good time
a bit of a mixed bag, this, as a ball is pushed down the leg side to give away another wide
pitched up, inviting the drive, but the timing isn't there and the ball dribbles into the leg side
nudged into the leg side with the spin, and they sprint through for a quick single as the fielder rushes in
huge vacant spaces on the leg side for Sangakkara, and he sends the ball in that direction for one more
Swann comes round the wicket to the right-hander but that can't stop the single, another tip-and-run into the leg side
pushed gently towards mid-on, Swann sprints across himself to stop the single
a toe-ended drive rolls back to the bowler
flighted up outside off, Sangakkara drives out to Pietersen on the cover boundary
Broad keeps it full, and Sangakkara clips a straight delivery to midwicket
nicely straight again, Sangakkara defends
Broad pitches another one up and this time Sangakkara doesn't hold back, stepping forward to thrash him down the ground!
and he follows that up with studied defence
a rising delivery, just outside off, is cut down to wide third man
dug in and spitting up towards the ribs, Chandimal's eye is in now though, and he rides the bounce to get the ball down to fine leg
Swann stays round the wicket to Chandimal, who drives back to the bowler
flicked to Cook at short fine leg, who gets the ball back in in a flash to stop the single
eased down to long-on for one
Sangakkara's outside edge is beaten by some sharp spin

a chipped drive flies towards short extra cover, where Eoin Morgan leaps to pluck the ball out of the air. There's the breakthrough! It's come against the run of play, and it may well be too late for England to change the course of this game, but Swann has given them some hope. Chandimal remains, however, and is looking really good
tossed up on off stump, Kandamby steps forward to defend to cover
nudged off the pads, they amble through for a single as midwicket trots in to field
a bouncer, and a sharp one, but Kandamby ducks underneath it in good time
back of a length again, Kandamby keeps his weight back and defends
banged in, Kandamby gets up on his toes to ride the bounce and guide the ball to fine leg
short and rising on middle and off, Chandimal's bottom hand comes off the bat as he defends
a little to predictable from Broad, another short one and Chandimal had set himself deep in the crease and right across to off, waiting for it and pulling neatly down to fine leg
Kandamby skips down the ground and chips over Swann's head, there were hopeful cries of "catch it!" but mid-off couldn't get close
tapped back to the bowler
quicker and flatter from Swann, the ball rushes on with the arm and is clipped to fine leg
a loud, pleading appeal from Swann as Chandimal is hit on the pad ... it pitched in line, but the umpire may have had some doubts about the height. Replays suggest it may have hit the top of middle
pushed into the leg side, straight to the fielder
tapped softly away to leg again, no run to be had
glanced behind square on the leg side
short of a good length, Chandimal defends with a hop
lifted powerfully into the stands! Chandimal was waiting for this, stepping into the shot and smiting the ball powerfully over midwicket
he follows that up with defence
four more, off the outside edge this time! Anderson pitched one full and wide, the ball taking a thick edge and flying down to third man
angled through gully to end another good over for Sri Lanka
tossed up on middle, Chandimal clips to midwicket
nudged through square leg, this time they will get the single
edged! But it flies well wide of Anderson at slip, and they sprint through for three
nudged defensively back down the track
tossed up high outside off, Chandimal defends to cover
a sliced late cut rolls down to third man, and they take two more before the fielder can get it in
nudged off the hip to fine leg
Dernbach steams in and loops down a back-of-the-hand slower delivery, and the ball rockets off the bat at at least double the pace it arrived! Thrashed over cover, Sri Lanka are closing in now
quicker this time, defended
very full outside off, Chandimal squeezes the ball to Morgan at backward point, bump ball
very slow indeed, Chandimal responds with watchful defence
glanced down to fine leg for one
another single is milked through the leg side
flighted on off stump, from around the wicket, and Kandamby drives back to the bowler
very full, Kandamby clips off the toes to midwicket
beaten by one that doesn't turn! Kandamby's bat was hanging outside the line, the ball struck his front pad in line with the stumps and Nigel Llong raised his finger to send him on his way
Mathews steps well down the track to defend his first ball
same again, he gets well forward to smother any spin and defends
scorching drive! Pietersen got a hand to it at cover - which must have stung - but it still had to be chased down near the boundary
another slower one, right up to the bat and dug out into the off side
full pace delivery this time, just back of a length and defended to leg
on a length outside off, Mathews gets across to cover the stumps and leaves alone
fired in much fuller and straighter, Mathews' bat comes down in solid defence
aimed at middle again, Mathews clips defensively to midwicket
punched out to deep cover off the back foot, just the single
well, it's defence first up
pushed gently to midwicket
quicker one from Swann, this one gripped a touch but is defended well enough
more defence
but he doesn't take it, dead-batting the ball away
great yorker, Chandimal digs it out to square leg ... and turns down the run!
full toss, Chandimal tries to go down the ground but doesn't come close to timing it. This time the single is taken
nudged through square leg, another single
Chandimal attempts the Dilscoop and gets a faint touch on it, Kieswetter leaps but can't stop it and they sprint through for two
a low full toss is dug out to mid-off
another attempted paddle, this time it fizzes right past him. And Mathews will have the strike in the next over!
past the outside edge! There didn't seem anything too special about the delivery, it was just on a good length outside off and he pushed inside it
full on off stump, defended to mid-onA
very full on off stump, dug out back to the bowler
ha, left alone!
what is going on out there? Mathews glances out to fine leg, and says no to the single! Dilshan is standing up and shouting from the balcony, he really isn't happy!
a maiden! Full toss on off stump and Mathews just taps it gently back to the bowler
Chandimal gives himself acres of room and digs out a yorker to point

finally! There's the hundred, Chandimal smashing the ball over wide long-on! Sri Lanka's fans are delirious with joy, as is Chandimal - who gets a big hug from a relieved Mathews - but there are some stony faces on the Sri Lanka balcony
dug out into the leg side for a single
pushed to leg, no single to be had
a full toss is tapped back to the bowler
full and straight, driven very hard but straight to mid-on
full on off stump, punched to cover
Chandimal gets down on one knee and slices Anderson over cover for four to end the match!
